definition[0]: a strong belief in the honesty, goodness etc of someone or something
example[0]: At first there was a lack of trust between them.
example[1]: an agreement made on the basis of mutual trust (=when people trust each other)
example[2]: You betrayed your father’s trust (=did something bad even though he trusted you).
example[3]: You shouldn’t put your trust in a man like that.
definition[1]: an organization or group that has control over money that will be used to help someone else
definition[2]: an arrangement by which someone has legal control of your money or property, either until you are old enough to use it or to invest  it for you
example[5]: The money your father left you will be held in trust until you are 21.
definition[3]: a group of companies that illegally work together to reduce competition and control prices
definition[4]: to believe that someone is honest or will not do anything bad or wrong
note[1]: not trust somebody an inch/not trust somebody as far as you can throw them (=not trust someone at all)
example[8]: He was a good driver and I trusted him implicitly.
example[9]: Can they be trusted to look after the house?
example[10]: I didn’t trust myself not to say something rude, so I just kept quiet.
definition[5]: to be sure that something is correct or right
example[13]: Trust your instincts (=do what you feel is the right thing)!
definition[6]: to be sure that something will work properly
example[14]: Not trusting her voice, she shook her head.
example[15]: You can’t trust the trains to run on time.
example[16]: He sat down suddenly, as if he didn’t trust his legs to support him.
definition[7]: a belief in the honesty or goodness of someone or something
example[17]: The measures are necessary to restore public trust in the futures markets.
example[18]: He abused his position of trust (=a job with responsibility for making important decisions) and defrauded the institution.
definition[8]: to believe that something is true without having any proof
example[19]: I just had to take it on trust that he would deliver the money.
definition[9]: an arrangement by which someone has legal control over your money or property until you are old enough to use it
definition[10]: an arrangement by which someone has legal control over your money and usually invests it for you, or an organization that does this
example[20]: He put his assets in a variety of trusts.
